newsitem.title: UKRAINE: Ukraine plans to tender rights to copper deposits.
newsitem.headline: Ukraine plans to tender rights to copper deposits.

text.p: Ukraine plans to hold an international tender for rights to explore and develop copper deposits, a State Geology Committee official said on Monday.
"We think this tender will take place in the first half of next year," Dmytro Hursky, head of the committee's deposits department, told Reuters.
He said initial findings in the Lutsk area of the Volyn region, 500 km west of Kiev, showed copper deposits as well as traces of gold and silver.
Vitaly Lovinyukov, head of the State Mines Commission at the State Geological Committee, said, "There are large, maybe huge, deposits there, but at this time no one can give exact figures."
He said the area had not yet been explored.
Volodymyr Starchenko, a top official from the Lutsk State Administration, said the tender would place tough conditions on investors but western firms were showing interest.

Ukraine, which in the past has imported finished copper from Mongolia and Kazakhastan and copper ore from Russia, has said it plans to boost copper production and to modernise its Artyomovsk rolled copper and alloys plant by the end of the century.
It has targeted output of 300,000 tonnes a year by 2000 from 1994's 50,000 tonnes, the last year for which official figures were available.
